info.title: COL's E-commerce API
info.description: API documentation for the e-commerce application

post.description:
Register a new user.

 This  endpoint  accepts the following parameters in JSON Request  body:.

- `fullName`: the full name of the user. 
- `email`: the email of the user. 
- `password`: The password of the user.

Login a new user.

 This  endpoint  accepts the following parameters in JSON Request  body: 

- `email`: The registered email address of the user. 

- `password`: The registered password of the user

get.description:
Get User Profile.

 This endpoint returns the authenticated user's data.

 The endpoint does not require any parameters, as it uses the authenticated user's data.

put.description:
Update The User Shipping Address 

 To Update The User Shipping Address, This  endpoint  accepts the following parameters in JSON Request  body: 

- `firstName`: The user first name. 

- `lastName`: The user last name. 

- `address`: The addrerss the user want to ship to. 

- `city`: The city the user is shipping to. 

- `postalCode`: The postalCode the user is shipping to. 

- `state`: The state the user is shipping to. 

- `country`: The country the user is shipping to. 

- `phoneNumber`: The phone number of the user.

post.description:
Create A Product 

 To create a product, This  endpoint  accepts the following parameters in JSON Request  body: 

- `name`: The name of the product. 

- `description`: The description of the product. 

- `brand`: The product brand. The product creation won't be successful if the brand is not among the brand already created. 

- `images`: The array of the product image url. This is optional. 

- `colors`: The arrays of color of the available product. 

- `category`: The category the product belong to. The product creation won't be successful if the category is not among the category already created. 

- `sizes`: The array of sizes available for the product. 

- `price`: The price of the product. 

- `totalQuantity`: The total available quantity of the product. 

 NOTE: Only an admin can create a product, so if you are getting a status code of 403 then it means you aren't an admin

get.description:
Get All Product 

 Fetch all product according to the queries

Get A Product. 

 Fetch a product with it product ID

put.description:
Update A Product. 

 To update the product, this endpoint accepts this following parameters is JSON format. 

- `name`

post.description:
Create A Category. 

 To create a category, this endpoint accept the following parameters in JSON request body: 

-`name`: The category name. 

-`image`: The URL of the category image

message.example: A new category is created successfully!

get.description:
Get All Categories. 

 Fetch all the categories

message.example: All category have been fetched successfully!

get.description:
Get A Category. 

 Fetch a category with it ID

put.description:
Update A Category. 

 To Update the category, the endpoint takes two parameters in JSON request body: 

- `name`:The new name of the category 

- `image`: The image representing the category. 

 The two parameter are not required, only the one you want to update.

post.description:

-`image`: The URL of the brand image

Update A Brand. 

 To Update the brand, the endpoint takes two parameters in JSON request body:

- `image`: The image representing the brand.

post.description:
Create A Coupon. 

 To create a coupon, this endpoint accept the following parameters in JSON request body: 

- `code`: The code of the coupon. 

- `startDate`: The starting Date of coupon. it must not be less than the current date. The format should be YYYY/MM/DD 

- `endDate`: The ending date of the coupon. It must not be less than the current date. The format should be YYYY/MM/DD 

- `discount`: The discount the coupon provide

get.description:
Get All Coupon. 

 Fetch all the coupon

Get A Coupon. 

 Fetch a coupon with the coupon code

put.description:
Update A Coupon. 

 To Update the coupon, this are the parameters that can be updated through the endpoint in JSON request body: 

- `code`: The code of the coupon. 

- `startDate`: The starting Date of coupon. it must not be less than the current date. The format should be YYYY/MM/DD 

- `endDate`: The ending date of the coupon. It must not be less than the current date. The format should be YYYY/MM/DD 

- `discount`: The discount the coupon provide
